title: WCAS ASIAN_AM 376-0-1 Advanced Topics in Literary and Cultural Studies

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course focuses on Arab American film, visual art, literature, and performance as a way to examine various political, ideological, and social issues of concern to Arab American communities. At the heart of our inquiry will be an interrogation of the relationship between representation and power. We will begin with a brief overview of how Arab culture has been represented in the US and then move on to examine Arab American arts and cinema as forms of self-representation. Readings in postcolonial theory, women of color feminist theory, and queer of color critique will provide analytical lenses through which to explore the aesthetic and political aspects of Arab American arts and cinema. Note: the midterm assignment will be based on interdisciplinary research conducted at a local Arab American
film festival.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
? Gain a general knowledge of the various forms of Arab American cultural productions, including: film, visual art, literature, and performance. ? Understand how the
histories of colonialism, imperialism, war, forced migration, exile, and racial formation inform the cultural politics of Arab American art and cinema. ? Gain a
general understanding of the relationship between representation and power. ? Gain knowledge of postcolonial, women of color feminist, and queer of color theories
and critiques of representation.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Attendance at a film festival screening is required as part of the midterm assignment. Anticipated cost is between $10 and $15. All course readings will be made available on Canvas.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Attendance at first class is mandatory.
